dt: {bc}a person admitted to a religious order as a probationary candidate for membership
{bc}a person on probation before being admitted as a candidate for holy orders in the Episcopal Church

et: French, petitioner, candidate, postulant, from Middle French, from present participle of {it}postuler{/it} to demand, solicit, from Latin {it}postulare{/it}
shortdef: a person admitted to a religious order as a probationary candidate for membership
a person on probation before being admitted as a candidate for holy orders in the Episcopal Church
